txt.en: Asmund the Poacher will no longer have work for you.
Asmund has one final request of you: to hunt the Hornéd Wood-lord, mightiest of the animals protected by the Elves of Lothlórien.

'This will be my final request of you, [placeholder], for it is my greatest hunt, and will be the last I ask you to undertake beyond the border of Lothlórien!

'Deep within the woods, protected by the Elves, lives the Hornéd Wood-lord, a creature of such impressive size and stature that its horns far surpass those of any creature that walks in Middle-earth!

'It is said that the Hornéd Wood-lord walks in the Golden Wood in an area called Egladil. Bring me his antlers, and I will reward you greatly!'
The Hornéd Wood-lord roams the Golden Wood in an area called Egladil, in south-east Lothlórien.\n\nAsmund has asked you to undertake one last hunt: to claim the antlers of the Hornéd Wood-lord.

'You have hunted the Hornéd Wood-lord, [placeholder]? Let me see those antlers!'

Asmund's face falls as he examines them.

'These are not as impressive as I was expecting, [placeholder]. I had thought, after all the stories, that these would be bigger. If I had known...

'What's done is done, I suppose. I promised you a reward, and you shall have it, though I am filled with a regret I had not expected.'
Asmund is in Echad Andestel, west of the border of Lothlórien.\n\nYou have hunted the Hornéd Wood-lord for his antlers and should bring them now to Asmund.

'It is said that the Hornéd Wood-lord's antlers are unsurpassed by any other creature that walks in Middle-earth! I must have them, [placeholder], even though the Hornéd Wood-lord is protected by the Elves. Look for him in a place called Egladil, in south-east Lothlórien.'
'You have not completed my hunt yet?'
Hunt the Hornéd Wood-lord for his antlers
